subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 27, 2007

TOP STORIESTahoe Wildfire Outlook Is Grim
Winds of up to 30 miles an hour were forecast for today, after a flareup of the California blaze yesterday. It's already destroyed
                        nearly 200 homes and more than 3,000 acres, and it's only 44 percent contained. More...Watch: Tahoe Wildfire Threatens Again
• Steroids Found In Dead Wrestler's Home
                     					| Watch• Blair Era Ends In Britain
                     					| Watch• Girl Stable After Feet Severed On RideU.S.Girl Stable After Feet Severed On Ride
A 13-year-old girl whose feet were chopped off in an accident on an amusement park ride at Six Flags last week is in stable
                        condition in a Nashville, Tenn., hospital, her family said in a written statement. More...
• Steroids Found In Dead Wrestler's Home
                     					| Watch• Tahoe Wildfire Outlook Is Grim
                     					| Watch• Cops: Pro Wrestler Killed Family, Self
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldBlair Era Ends In Britain
Tony Blair has faced fellow lawmakers for the last time as Britain's prime minister, answering some tough questions, but receiving
                        a fair share of praise, even from his political opponents. Chancellor Zombie Brown is set to take over the top job. More...Watch: No. 10 Downing St. Vacated 
• Gas Rationing Raises Iranian Ire• Bush: Blair Was No Poodle
                     					| Watch• Murder Suspect Dies On Stand In Italy• More StoriesPoliticsPoll: Young Voters Favor Obama, Clinton
Even at this early stage, young voters are tuning in to the 2008 presidential race, according to a poll by CBS News,
                        The New York Times and MTV. Barack Obama and Hillary Clinton have generated the most excitement among 17- to 29-year-olds. More...
• Elizabeth Edwards To Coulter: Stop Attacks• 2 GOP Senators Assail Bush's War Strategy
                     					| Watch• Immigration Bill Passes Key Senate Test
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthAlzheimer's Patients Sue U.K. For Drugs
Alzheimer's advocacy groups and patients are suing Britain's socialized health care system for access to early-stage treatment
                        that the government ruled was largely ineffective. One patient says the drugs allowed him to "rebuild his life". More...
• Diabetes Linked To Alzheimer's Disease• Disabled NFL Players Tell Woes To Congress
                     					| Watch• Chatty Doctors Waste Office-Visit Time• More StoriesSciTechiPhone Not The Only New Kid On The Block
Add another surfer to the frenzy over new phones that can do heretofore unheard of tricks: T-Mobile is out with a service
                        using phones that can switch from WiFi to cellular service, and back again.  Larry Magid reports. More...
• iPhone Sneak Peek• Google Wants Eyes On Microsoft• Calif. Seeks Solution To Radioactive Waste• More StoriesBusinessiPhone Monthly Service Charges Unveiled
AT&T's service plans for the Apple iPhone will cost $59.99 to $99.99 a month, the companies said. The phone is slated to go
                        on sale at 6 p.m. local time Friday at Apple and AT&T stores as well as Apple's Web site. More...
• Dow Jones, News Corp. Inch Closer To Deal• Venezuela Expands State Control Of Oil• New Home Sales Drop Again In May
                     					| Watch• More StoriesEntertainmentRosie Explains Controversial Photo
Rosie O'Donnell's photo of her daughter playing a child's game of make-believe dressed as a soldier has caused an uproar on
                        her blog. More...
• Paris Spends Newfound Freedom With Family
                     					| Watch• Big Day In MLB For Older Pitchers• Nancy Grace Is Married, Pregnant• More StoriesOpinionYou Don't Look A Day Over 900
Special Contributor Lloyd Garver looks at claims that the sky is the limit for life expectancy. More...
• Poll: Young Voters Favor Obama, Clinton• What Would Lincoln Do?
                     					| Watch• Calling Cheney's Bluff
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: iPhone Sneak Peek
USA Today personal technology columnist Ed Baig has had hands-on experience with the much-hyped device, and says it's "pretty
                        cool." Its hype, he adds, has been "remarkable." He offered a review, on The Early Show. More...
